Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (8 ll. and 17 ll. at the left side) and verso (vestiges of the names of 16 witnesses). Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Fragments of a single sheet containing part of a contract and an appended note at the side [...] Marriage settlement between Pelaias son of Sisuchos and ... A list of the wife's paraphernalia appended. Date. year (lost) of Cleopatra III and Ptol. Alexander = BC. 108-100".
Curator's comments: Kaplony-Heckel, U., Das Getreide-Darlehn P. Haun. Inv. Demot. 2, in K. Ryholt (ed.), Acts of the seventh international conference of Demotic studies. Copenhagen, 2002, 247. Text 23 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (C.J. Martin/S.E. Thomas). Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT (the papyrus is here listed under two entries, 10570 b and 10570 c).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (333) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/333)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, loss, insect attack, abraded, fractured Black ink Backed: white paper Tabbed: silk Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Alan Henderson Gardiner
